review: We love coming here with our kids. Their kids menu is fantastic and the service is always incredible. Our kids never leave hungry and the free balloon at the end of the meal is a bonus! Perfect family restaurant or a great place for a date night.

Definitely in a great location.  I had the Smoked Pepper Burger, everything about it was good except for the bacon, it was EXTREMELY stringy and tasted odd.  The waitress was great for the first part, but once our food came out, she never checked up on us, no refills or anything.  Only saw her one other time to ask for the check. Considering she only had two tables it was a bit odd that she was so hard to find.  Still have 4 stars though because she was good when she was there and the burger was overall, very good, besides the bacon.

I don't come here often but when I do the service is always fantastic.  Burgers are the speciality and there are plenty to choose from to satisfy any appetite.  During a recent lunch visit, I had the guacamole burger, which was very good and cooked just as I asked.  If you're hungry for a burger, but want to avoid the fast food chains, Red Robin is a great alternative.

Horrible experience!!! Ordered the seasonal burger and was extremely disappointed. Paid over $14 and it doesn't even come out right. The food too over 3 minutes including kids meals. In addition, never got the change to have more fries. The waitress want exactly friendly either. I definitely won't be back. The price for what you get is not worth it. Don't waste your time or money. Plenty of other places to go.

I typically enjoy a good Red Robin meal, but my last experience has me feeling like it's not worth me going out of my way to come back for more.  I started off with the Red Spanish Sangria... save your money, because it was BLAND. This drink gives Sangria a bad name. I believe it is here for a limited time, try it for yourself and let me know what you think... maybe I just received a bad batch?!? I literally went this particular evening for their patty melt, and could literally tasty the goodness of the burger, melted provolone cheese and caramelized onions, all sandwiched in-between rye bread. To me, the rye bread makes the patty melt, but to my surprise I was advised AS my burger arrived that Red Robin no longer uses rye bread and instead I received Texas toast. I am not a fan of Texas toast, and had I known prior, I would have changed my order. I didn't want to make a fuss about it, but the "patty melt" was not the same without the Rye bread.  #BringBackTheRye Red Robin.

I admit, this Red Robin is usually my go-to when I'm craving a good burger.  We've dined here 6 or so times, and with each experience we've had: excellent and friendly service with timely table checks, food (more often then not, burgers) that are juicy and well-prepared, and a cheap bill (great prices for the food received). This place is also very accommodating for large groups, in my case, for lunch meetings. This is a place that seems to plan reservations with their schedule, so you will still receive timely service even in a large number. (This is very important for those that need to be in and out within their lunch hours!) Just make sure you call ahead of time in consideration. :) In my most recent visit, I ordered a few appetizers: the fried pickles and pretzel bites, along with the small doughnut tower. Now, the doughnuts certainly aren't the ricotta doughnuts I know and love from a favorite restaurant of mine... But these ones help fill the void. They're very soft on the inside. However, the chocolate sauce they serve with it has a flavor reminiscent of a child's chocolate lip balm. The berry sauce is decent. If they served a salted caramel and/or much better chocolate sauce, these doughnuts would be terrific!  With great staff and great food, this place is a winner! I know, I know... chain burger place... But good food is good food!

Worst Red Robbin experience ever.  They were severely understaffed for the lunch time crowd on a normal weekday.  Restaurant looked quite empty, but waited 10 minutes for a table for 4 before walking out once it was obvious we would be waiting much longer.

This is my first visit and requested a booth for 2. We w re given a tiny booth which was claustrophobic. Requested another booth and was told because we expect to be busy we can't put you in a bigger booth. But as I looked around I found at least 2 big booths with no more than 2 people in those booths. Yes I have pictures to prove it if necessary. Needless to say I won't be back. My friend visiting from out of state wanted a Burger so I did not want to spoil her meal so I stayed. Not happy.

Great Red Robins the staff is friendly and the food is good. The staff is friendly and this location has great burgers and fries this location is really good. I like the fries because they are unlimited and I sat a ton of them they are good. I like Red Robin.

I was overall disappointed with Red Robin... We arrived around 5:20 on a Tuesday, so they weren't terribly busy. Our server was kind, which is always a plus, but from there everything went down hill. When we had decided that we wanted the boneless barbecue wings as our appetizer, our waitress told us we HAD to use the little electronic thing at our table. First off, I hate those things. I find them impersonal, which proved true. We submitted our order and then gave our meal order to the waitress. When our wings arrived, my wife and I were really disappointed. They had brought us their wings, but had just lightly drizzled barbecue on them whereas there menu shows them coated in sauce. When our burgers arrived I was let down even more. It's not that our burgers were bad, they were just, well, normal tasting. If I wanted a mediocre-tasting burger, we would've went to McDonald's or something... Even better was that it was my wife's birthday, which we mentioned to our waitress so we could us our rewards club to get her burger free. She didn't even wish my wife a happy birthday or anything. Not that they have to, just would've been nice to show that she cared we were there. We were also required to is the electronic thing to check out. Once again, felt impersonal.

The meal price was great.  To get a good burger and endless fries for 6.99 to 8.99 is great.   The only probably is slow service (one refill on fries and one refill on water) and we were there for over 1hr and 15mins.

Red Robin never disappoints! Fast friendly service and the burgers are always fantastic!! Royal Red Robin is a must try. We sat at a table in the bar area. Waitress was fantastic!!! I don't think I've ever been in and out so quickly at a Red Robin. We will certainly go back again and again.

I describe myself as a burger buff. I could live off of nothing but good burgers for months at a time. With that being said, I'm pretty picky when it comes to burgers and judge them a little more harshly than I do other foods.  I've never had a bad experience at this Red Robin. Always great service and fresh, juicy burgers cooked perfectly. There are a variety a flavors (try the bacon guac or Royal Red Robin burger featuring a fried egg on top). Fries are well seasoned and did I mention endless?! What's not to love!

We chose RR for a quick dinner after I had driven 6 hours and had no desire to make dinner.  Coupons came in the mail to drum up business after this location had a fire and had been closed awhile.  Busy when we arrived, seated pretty quickly.  Our server Jenny was awesome, actually the best part of this visit. We both got burgers.  They were only okay, not great flavor.  Fries were okay, too.  We got a $6 break on the meal, but probably won't be back.  Too many other choices in the area.

Second step during my burger survey in the U.S.  I was here with some friends that suggest me that describe me the place as "dangerous" since you can have UNLIMITED FRENCH FRIES. Due to this, I said just: "let's go". Red robin's burger are pretty good. My choice was the  the whiskey river bbq burger without mayo and for 11$ I don't regret: crispy onion straws, Cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes. Awesome! I also tasted one of my new addictions "Sweet potatoes french fries" and they were good. Really good.  Just a note, we had to wait a bit to get our meals, anyways it was a Sunday evening so the restaurant was kind of crowded so it wasn't a big deal for me. What to say more, I'll be back for sure, hopefully soon!

I could definitely go back here!  This was my first experience with Red Robin, the only thing I knew about them was the commercial I would hear periodically on TV.  My first impression is that I can't believe that there is a wait to be seated? Well, a place that is a little more than just "fast food".   Honestly, I was more than pleased with my burger, and what is not to love about unlimited fries?  Crispy steak fries I might add.   I will also say that the Patron pear-toni I had was not too shabby either.  I could see myself trying several of the other burgers or just go for dessert one night (boozy milkshake anyone?)
All you can eat baskets of fries! Food is fast food , but good. Nice bar and interior is pleasant. Reasonably priced. Great lunch spot.

We frequent this location very often but we have now waited for ONE table for 12... (cause I assume that they can not put another section of tables together in this big restaurant) waiting for 2 hrs as the manager has no clue and proceeds to tell us that they are waiting for this ONE table to quit visiting so he can seat us!! Are you kidding? The manager has no clue!! I am sure corporate would be so proud of his ignorance!

The food at this Red Robin is always solid. The problem with this Red Robin is that it is packed  all of the time. You could go to this location as soon as they open, you would walk in and find the whole place packed and you looking at an hour wait.  If you're looking for a fast place to eat before a movie at Regal, I would just go somewhere else. If you've got some time to kill, for sure stop in here and get a Guacamole Bacon Burger, and eat your body weight in bottomless fries.  Also, the hostesses here are always really rude and un-friendly. All the servers I've had here have been really cool, and good at what they do. The hostesses though could, at least, try to act like they don't hate their lives. That would be nice to be greeted that way.

One of my friends has a restaurant 'blacklist'.  Going out to eat with him is like navigating a minefield, as he consistently opposes suggestions, claiming "stomach issues" or any number of intestinal maladies.  If he really did have foot poisoning or the like every time he went out, he'd never leave the toilet. The reason I bring this up?  Red Robin in Beavercreek is one of the few restaurants that's managed to stay off of his 'blacklist' for years.  As such, this past Sunday we found ourselves in the crowded Red Robin lobby, surrounded by three foot high ankle-biters. Honestly?  That's my biggest problem with Red Robin:  the 'family' atmosphere.  Every time I go there, the place is utterly packed with kids, many of whom are either unsupervised or poorly supervised, leaving the servers to navigate a flood pre-pubescent weasels while trying to deliver food. But, that's not a knock on the restaurant itself, really; just my personal preference.  Red Robin's famous for their burgers, of which they have varieties in spades.  These vary in flavor and topping, but sadly enough, they all seem to taste relatively the same.  That's a telling issue, right there, when the different cheeses all meld together and the patty tastes of so much unseasoned meat. Steak fries, similarly, have come into Red Robin's parlance but these, too, seem mediocre.  Mine came unseasoned, with only the barest trace that salt ever touched them.  The Red Robin menu offered a number of (notably upcharged) dipping sauces.  I didn't indulge, though my aforementioned friend chose the "Smoky Bacon" sauce, which he claimed didn't look or taste the same as the one that he had ordered on prior visits.  Didn't stop him from eating it, though! I realize that this review sounds fairly negative; it's not really meant to be, but my entire experience at Red Robin echoes one word:  mediocre.  I feel like I could get a better, fresher experience at Smashburger or any number of sports bars through the region.

We just got back from here, had another great experience. We were seated right away, even at the table we prefer. Got drinks quickly from pleasant waitress. Food came out quickly, food was hot and burgers were fixed just as ordered. No problem getting  refills on drinks or fries as waitress checked back with us several times. Will definitely be back.

This place was packed.  I'm not used to waiting for a restaurant that won't serve me fresh or local food.  The burger was fine as were the bottomless sweet potato fries and appetizers. Swamped, it is completely understandable that the server was slow and we were always waiting on something/waving him down.  Bottomless fries are only bottomless if you have a server.   The only reason we went was because of the free birthday burger?  Well you have to sign up for a rewards program or something and because our friend with the birthday didn't sign up far enough in advance, everyone wasted their money here.  The rest of the group had apparently come in a week before and done the same thing with the same server for a different birthday.  I'm sure they tipped well before but the service and inability to honor their deal was unbelievable.  We had his ID... it was his birthday... I could have paid 1/3 the price at steak n shake for the same thing and no wait.  I'm so confused.  Maybe my problem is that I can make better at home.  Or that the burgers are $12? Not as good as a $5 milkshake from Jack Rabbit Slims.  That's for sure.

Is it possible to be in love with a hamburger place?   This place is delicious in a drip down your face ask for extra napkins you need to run around the block five extra million times because you just gained 5lbs way.

I have to say that Red Robin lived up to my high expectations. My family raved about the delicious burgers that Red Robin prides themselves on and boy were they right. The good 'ol regular all american cheeseburger rates right up there with one of the best cheeseburgers I have ever had. Super yum!! Their fries were ok. I totally appreciated the suggestion from a fellow yelper to order your fries as soon as you sit down. They made a tasty (and free) appetizer.  We sat the bar and service was ok. Nothing spectacular but nothing to complain about. It was super cool that the bartender let my husband try a beer before he ordered it. Fortunately she did because it did not please his palate so he stuck to good old ___ (fill in the blank because I have no clue what he ended up ordering). I really thought it was cool that the manager came by to refill our fries since business seemed to be picking up. Overall, I will be back. Great food at a good price!

Today was the first time I've been here in nearly 10 years and had forgotten how great their burgers tasted. I had their charbroiled bacon cheese burger and it tasted awesome! The burger was very juicy, full of flavor, and the price was just right. To top it off, there's unlimited steak fries. I think the seasoning on the fries is a little bland, but you can't beat the unlimited servings! I gave it 4 stars because of their strawberry cheesecake. I think the cheesecake is just so-so and the strawberry wasn't fresh, it's frozen. Other than that, I think the burgers are definitely worth visiting this place for!

When I need a good burger fix and I'm in the area, Red Robin never fails to deliver. I love their burning love burger, and although I don't THINK they're on the menu anymore, they will still make the garlic fries. Yes, they're terrible for you. Yes, I don't really care. It's busy most of the time there due to the area, so occasionally you'll have to wait a few to be seated or served. But sit back, enjoy, grab a freckled lemonade, and relax.

Came here on a Monday night with a group of friends. Got seated right away. Having never been here I wasn't sure what to expect. There is movie posters all over the restaurant. They had an ok alcohol solution, the draft beer wasn't fantastic. The actual menu has 2 pages of burgers and 2 pages of non burger options. I ordered the royal red robin which was a burger with bacon, cheese, and a sunny side egg along with lettuce, mayo, and tomato. I also ordered the sweet potato fries for an up charge of $1.49. The burger was cooked perfect and had a great flavor to it. The sweet potato fries were quite tasty as well. I was a little disappointed in the amount of fries I got. I had heard red robin is known for their bottomless fries. So when my ordered came I was expecting a huge amount of fries, when in reality I got a very small amount. After I finished the meal the waitress came around and asked if I waned more. Which I again I thought was odd since I was already done.  The place was clean and friendly and the burger was good but I would not put it in my top ten.

This is my favorite chain restaurant. They always seem to have excellent service at this location.  A few of my favorites are the Sauteed Shrooms,The Chop House Burger, Bonsai, and when I don't feel like a burger the Chicken Bruschetta sandwich is lights out. My all-time go to is the Royal Red Robin, which comes with a fried egg and bacon. So not only do you get a tasty burger, but you get your breakfast too. They have a decent beer selection and excellent milkshakes. Overall I love this place.

This was an extremely disappointing experience. We stopped for dinner around 8:00 PM this evening(Sunday night). The restaurant was half-filled or less. It was disgusting. There were used napkins, used silverware, food scrap, crayons & other things all over the floor. During our entire stay, nobody picked up anything from the floor. Nobody brought out a broom or vacuum. I decided to address the situation with the manager on duty but I spotted him at the food window helping to get food out. The floor around him had several dirty napkins and other stuff that needed to be cleaned up as well. It didn't seem useful to address the issue with him when he was obviously aware and doing nothing.  Bad experience.
Good food, service ok, forgot to go silverware three of last five visits. Called manager, comped a meal, forgot silverware the week later again. Love the food options, wish the service was better.
The unlimited steak fries are awesome!  The burgers were cooked properly just like requested. The wait staff was very attentive and made sure are drinks were full at all times.
They do not take reservations, so calling ahead telling them that you have a big group coming is unless.
Beavercreek OH-- nice store, great burgers , and very clean bathrooms. Banzai burger was excellent. They cook to order-- and are very quick with service.

Second time I have ordered carry out from this location and had my meal improperly made. I ordered the deluxe cheese burger with no mayo but to add ketchup and mustard. Somehow that was taken to mean a plain cheeseburger with a little bit of mustard, and burnt. Dine in may be a completely different experience but I will not be ordering carry out from this location anymore.

The absolute worst Red Robin I've ever been to. As a member of the military I've had the opportunity to travel to many Red Robin installations across the country. This one is by far the absolute worst but they're super consistent about being the worst. Bad service often resulting in receiving a mixed up order, entrees coming out before appetizers, never ending wait for the never ending fries, and just completely forgetting to put the order in. If you eat here, prepare to be here for a really really long time no matter how few customers there may be. Just walk over to Spinoza's, those guys are way better.

I love this place..... The burgers are great and the unlimited fries are a tasty bargain. Make sure you get the red robin card: it's free and gives discounts sometimes with promotions and also a free burger on your birthday. The only bad thing about this restaurant is it's always crowded and it kills my diet.

Once upon a time, a beautiful princess journeyed for six long hours to visit a friend in the hilariously named town of Beavercreek, Ohio. Famished, she and her friend headed to Red Robin for some much-needed nourishment and merriment.  Inside, the princess requested a salted caramel shake and a Gardenburger patty dressed as the Bleu Ribbon (The princess was a vegetarian and loved that she could have dressed up "burgers" here). As she waited for her food, she noted that the air was a bit chilly, so she wrapped her scarf around her arms. Soon, a young maiden of perhaps five years approached her shyly. The girl, dressed in pink, grew wide-eyed and suggested that princess resembled Snow White with her long, dark hair and bow headband. The princess giggled and thanked the sweet girl.  The server soon returned with the princess's meal, remembering to bring barbeque sauce for her fries and an extra glass so that her friend could share the milkshake. The food was hearty as always and precisely what the princess had requested. The shake was so delicious that the princess even briefly considered ordering a second one, but she was growing sleepy from the journey and needed to return to her friend's house to catch up on "American Horror Story." When the time came to pay the bill, the server told the princess (after applying her Red Robin Royalty account) that her "burger" was free and that only payment for the shake was necessary. The server also leaned close and divulged, "I heard what what little girl had told you, and she was right - You do look like Snow White. You're adorable." And with that, the server turned into a prince and disappeared forever. The princess then vowed to always leave her puffy sleeved royal attire at home and only dine in her Weezer shirt and giant glittery bow headband from that day forward. The end.

Didn't even eat there. They wouldn't take a party of 16 which they have before. The business they could have gotten and the tip a server could have made. We ended up else where. Guess we won't try red Robin again.

Red Robin is a great place to get a burger. The Whiskey River BBQ Burger is my personal favorite. The steak fries with the seasoning sprinkled on them are great, too. I would stay away from the Prime Chophouse burger if I were you. I got brave one day and tried that, and I thought my nose was gonna burn off. It was awful.  Wait times can get a little long if you go at the wrong time.

Great burgers! Black and bleu is my favorite can't forget the tower of onion with the amazing Campfire sauce. Nice atmosphere, family setting, open bar, music playing, loud at times so crying children is appropriate.

Recommended to me a few times by associates. We tried this restaurant and have returned a number of times, and recommended it also. Simply great service and food. All parts of the meal were outstanding. Management was also seen an checking with customers We will continue to visit this one

Their burgers are so great. Love the Burning Love burger, which has just the right amount of salsa. They also do bottomless freckle lemonade (lemonade with strawberries) and wide French fries. I have never had a desert there because I am just too full.......

The Garlic fries are great.  Tip...  Order your refill of fries after you first sit down (when ordering your drinks) and they will come out as appetizers.  That way you have your munchies while waiting on the food.  We picked a busy time to attend, 2pm on a Saturday.  The place was packed, with many parties waiting in the lobby for seats.   After a short 20 minute wait we were graciously escorted to our seats.  The entire staff was friendly and eager to assist us; which is amazing considering how busy they were.  I would like to give a shout out to our waitress "Jaden".  She did an awesome job.  Before our drinks were half empty, we had new ones waiting.  She was constantly coming by the table to make sure we were good to go; and always with a big smile. The only negative is that the burgers were a bit dry.   Not sure how they cooked it, but the drained every bit of moisture out.  Thank goodness for the full bottle of ketchup.

Got an overpriced burger that was lackluster in flavor despite the specialty sauces they offer and the bun was beyond dry to the point of cardboard consistency. To make matters worse, I was quite ill afterwards and I have no doubt it was to blame. The only positive thing i have to say is the fries were superb, but I will never go back again.

Came on a Wednesday.  Was quoted 15 minutes . After 30 minutes they claim they seated another party under our name.  Service was Mediocre -drinks took forever and not friendly.  Appreciate the food - great burgers and the fries are great.  Didn't know about bottomless fries - speaks for the service since we did finish every single French fry on our table.

Visited this Red Robin once.  Took my daughter.  We got burgers off the menu, no appetizer and nothing super exotic.   The burgers are supposed to come with endless steak fry refills aren't they?  Just try to find your server to get more.  The burger itself was OK.. Not spectacular. The check came to $34 before tip for burgers, fries and sodas.   I can get Meh burgers for a lot less than that.  Won't be going back..

it's a chain place, so its going to have its ups and downs. been there twice. first time was good and pretty much what you would expect from a chain restaurant. 2nd time we went, we never got silverware until we had to go hunt someone down to get us some, like 15 mins later we finally got some from the manger. i mean did ya'll's dishwasher fall in to a coma and forgot to do dishes for the dinner rush. over it is just like any other chain restaurant.

Their tagline sums it up well..."YUM". This location gets very crowded during the dinner rush hour so I tend to avoid dining here during that peak time as wait time can easily succeed an hour. But if one gets here a little before 5 pm or after 8 pm, a table is easily available. My favorite time to indulge is for a weekend lunch. I've always received great service here-friendly and quick. I've probably visited over 20 times and have never been disappointed with my meal. Favorites are the Bonzai Burger which has a nice teriyaki glaze and pineapple or the Red Tavern Double which showcases their "secret sauce". I give props that they now offer sweet potato fries in addition to their Red Robin fries. Both are good and allow for bottomless servings though I've yet to make it through one. I'm enjoying the addition of the sauce offerings as fry accompaniments. The garlic one was quite tasty! Shakes here are de-li-ci-ous!! For a non-alcoholic option try the salted caramel or for those indulging in a festive beverage, go for the Baileys shake. Spend the $1 more to get the shake refill cup. Otherwise, you will wish you had when you reach the bottom of the cup.
Came here for dinner on 6/25; the service was great. Our server was very polite and we could sense she enjoyed her job.  Food was cooked the way we ordered and tasted great.

Always awesome! Great selection of burgers, appetizers are great! Always have great service. It's funny to read people complaining about prices because it's "just a burger".  You get what you pay for, McDonalds sells burgers too if that's your price range.  A forever fan of Red Robin!!!

The food is good, but the service leaves a lot to be desired. When we got there they were not busy, it was after 9pm on a Monday. We were sat down right away, but our waitress didn't come over to even look at us for about another 10 minutes. When she finally showed up, she was very short and rude. She took our order, delivered it and then barely came back out to check on our drinks or anything!! She just seem to not be able to handle the amount of people she was given to serve. I don't know that I will go back, cause service at a place is very important to me.

Up until last night, I had never been to a Red Robin in my life.  I was a bit hesitiant when my lady friend suggested it.  However, my hesitation proved to be ill founded.  First off, our server, Nathan, did an outstanding job.  The guy had a great attitude and was a complete and total all-star, making our experience all the more enjoyable.  My burger was cooked to absolute perfection, the steak fries were beautifully crisp, and they sent out a plethora of pickles with my burger.  4 plastic ramekins filled!  I'm a bit of a pickle fiend, so when I request heavy pickles for my burger, that's exactly what I mean.  Restaurants seldom get this request right, Red Robin nailed it.  I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of food and service I experience from this establishment.  I will be return customer.
I cannot get enough of their food!!! Sweet potato fries are addictive!!! The beer shake is AMAZING !!!

Love the food here.  I get the shroom burger and it's awesome.  They will only cook meet to medium though... and the are strict about this.  So we order as pink as we can get! Despite this, the burgers are moist and juicy and quite flavorful.

I'm sorry, but I've been here twice and I just don't find the hamburgers to be anything special. When I was here about a year ago, I thought maybe they were having a bad day. Then I went back yesterday and was again unhappy with the burger. I don't know how this place got rated as one of Dayton's best burgers. I enjoy the burger at the Pine Club much better and it's the same price.    On the up side, the steak fries are great and it's what they call endless.   They don't know me...... I could keep on eating those all the way thru a super bowl game.

Banzai burger with onion rings and a speckled lemonade?  Yes please.  My kids love this place and who am I to argue?  Great for families, but you cannot leave without ingesting 700+ calories.  You might get a balloon though.  So there is that.
Fast service, good food, servers are friendly and reach out to help me with selecting items from the menu. Never knew burger can have so many varieties. And all of them can be made with Vegi patties.

The Angus burger from McDonald's is way better than this, and half the price. Had the fish and chips the other day. They were skimpy, over-battered, dry, and tasteless. And they cost $12.99!  This place ranks up there as worst fish and chips ever. One good thing about them is their bottomless potato fries and wings. Service is usually good, and they have a nice bar.

This was my first time to any Red Robin and it was a great experience. The wait service was good and prompt with taking orders and bringing food. Their menus are very complete with an excellent range of options even if you don't want to try the amazing burgers. The environment's good and so is the food although a little higher on the price range. Check it out if you're in the area. And thanks for the tip Adam, I gotta try the shakes next time.

They have some interesting varieties of burger flavors that might be good if the underlying burger was better. The burgers always seem to be rather dry. It's a shame because some of the toppings and stuff seem to be pretty good. Oddly, their non-burgers are much better. Nothing spectacular there either, but not bad. Over all I'd give it a pass. I would almost give them a pass to 3 stars, except that the prices are a bit high for the quality. There a tons of better burger places in the area.

Great gourmet burgers - I like most all of them.  Onion rings are delicious with their campfire sauce.  Steak fries are ok, prefer the thin variety.  Service is great!  We once had a wedding shower with a small group of friends and the manager went out and bought a gift for the engaged couple.  On the expensive side for burgers but worth it.

Took my father there for his 79th birthday 9-22-12.   Appetizer, drinks, food all cooked to order, hot or cold as it was supposed to be, and tasted awesome.  GKids got chicken fingers, chick on stick (he has allergies to eggs, pnuts and tree nuts, and shellfish).   They have wonderful allergen guide for all their foods and we have never had a problem there.   Myself and one daughter got Oktoberfest Burgers, one daughter got boca burger cooked Burnin Love style, mother got Blue Cheese burger, and dad got grilled chicken salad.   Our appetizer of onion ring tower was hot and tasty.   Calories were horrible, but food great.  And my grandsons were so excited about hearing Happy Birthday sang to their grandfather; sadly they came to the table when 4 of us were in the restroom.  That was the only bummer.   :(

Red Robin is one of the few very "family friendly" restaurants in the area.  Good burgers and good chicken "burgers" in a very relaxed atmosphere.  I have been here a few times where service was terrible, but it seems that it has been those servers and not the place in general.  They have bottomless fries here and here's a tip...in lieu of an appetizer, ask for a basket or two of fries while you wait, it's free and tasty.  Milk shakes here are also fantastic.
